Men have torn asunder, boiled in oil, stoned to a pulp, broken
on the rack, electrocuted, hung, and shot to death those of their
fellow men called criminals0 This has been going on for a long
tlme0
Men have also opened their arms and hearts, torn down the grey
prisons, taken the lash away from embittered warders; have sought
to temper Justice, and have probed into the twisted, dark souls of
those who rebel, who hate, who kill.The open heart, the
seeking mind, these are things of today0
The evidence is now overwhelmingly conclusive that punishment
per se does not deter criminal behavior 0 r^here is evidence to
indicate that quite to the contrary, it acts to beget crime 0 well
remembered in English history is the giving up of the public execu¬
tion of the pickpocket, for during the festive day more pockets
than ever were picked„ The lash was seldom if ever a good teacher0
On the other hand, modem philanthropy, social work, psychiatry,
and the settlement house have provided no optimistic assurance that
the "enlightened" approach brings about an abatement of danger in
the streets and by-ways of our cities, There is also evidence to
indicate that settlement houses and boys* clubs can serve as an
infectious foci of crime and delinquency o
